page.title: 16Pastimes of Haywood people
page.content: The people of Haywood are able to enjoy many forms of recreation. Jogging is very popular, and fishermen are always seen sitting along the side of the Trent and Mersey Canal. The sport of 'microliting' is becoming increasingly popular, the pilots taking off from Far Coley Farm or nearby Shugborough Park. Hot Air Balloons are a common sight over the area. The youth of Colwich have their own Youth centre close to the church, and there are the usual Brownie, Cub Scout and Guide Packs in the villages. For adults there are several associations, including the W.I., Housewives Register, Haywood Society and Village Produce Guild. There are village senior and junior football teams, and other teams linked to the local pubs. There are two Public Houses in Little Haywood.
